Research Teaching Service CV Gallery

Alexander Wilson

Taken by Tom Roby at the Discrete Math Day workshop at Smith College
This site was last updated on July 7, 2024. It was created using Jekyll with interactive components running on p5.js.

Research

I am primarily interested in algebraic combinatorics, which aims to answer questions about algebraic structures through the use of combinatorial objects like graphs or tableaux. In particular, I am interested in applying these techniques to the area of representation theory.

Slides

  • SSMC Jun 6, 2024: Crystal Structures on Bitableaux (20min survey talk) [slides]
  • GOCC Feb 15, 2023: A Diagram-Like Basis for the Multiset Partition Algebra [video] [slides]
  • JMM Jan 5, 2023: A Diagram-Like Basis for the Multiset Partition Algebra [slides]

Publications and preprints

  • Coloring Groups (with Ben Adenbaum), accepted for publication in Discrete Mathematics & Theoretical Computer Science [arXiv 2312.03092] [GitHub]
  • Super Multiset RSK and a Mixed Multiset Partition Algebra, preprint [arXiv 2308.07238] [GitHub]
  • A Diagram-Like Basis for the Multiset Partition Algebra, accepted for publication in Algebraic Combinatorics [arXiv 2307.01353]
  • The Multiset Partition Algebra: Diagram-Like Bases and Representations. Ph.D. Thesis, Dartmouth College 2023 [pdf]
  • Closed Forms of Recursive Polynomials and Applications (with M. Haver, K. Lee, W. McDermott, W. Yu, A. Zeleke), Ars Combinatoria, 142 (2019), 175-195.
